abstract_summ: OBJECTIVES: The COVID-19 pandemic has consumed considerable resources and has impacted the delivery of cancer care.In some cases, this necessitates increased use of genomic tumor profiling on core biopsy specimens to guide neoadjuvant therapy decisions.Breast cancer treatment during the pandemic requires multidisciplinary input and varies according to stage, tumor biology, comorbidities, age, patient preferences, and available hospital resources.These algorithms emphasize medical oncology treatment decisions and demonstrate how we have operationalized the general treatment recommendations during the pandemic proposed by national groups, such as the COVID-19 Pandemic Breast Cancer Consortium.In order to treat patients safely while protecting medical teams, the entire health care system must optimize the way it approaches prevention and treatment at a time when social distancing is key to stemming this pandemic.
title_summ: Head and neck cancer radiotherapy amid COVID‐19 pandemic: Report from Milan, ItalyAdapting palliative radiation therapy for bone metastases during the Covid-19 pandemic: GEMO position paperAnti-cancer therapy and clinical trial considerations for gynecologic oncology patients during the COVID-19 pandemic crisis()Management of primary skin cancer during a pandemic: Multidisciplinary recommendationsManagement of Breast Cancer During the COVID-19 Pandemic: A Stage- and Subtype-Specific Approach.
title_abstract_phrases: Adapting palliative radiation therapy for bone metastases during the Covid-19 pandemic: GEMO position paperThe current health crisis caused by COVID-19 is a challenge for oncology treatment, especially when it comes to radiotherapy.In some cases, this necessitates increased use of genomic tumor profiling on core biopsy specimens to guide neoadjuvant therapy decisions.Breast cancer treatment during the pandemic requires multidisciplinary input and varies according to stage, tumor biology, comorbidities, age, patient preferences, and available hospital resources.These algorithms emphasize medical oncology treatment decisions and demonstrate how we have operationalized the general treatment recommendations during the pandemic proposed by national groups, such as the COVID-19 Pandemic Breast Cancer Consortium.In order to treat patients safely while protecting medical teams, the entire health care system must optimize the way it approaches prevention and treatment at a time when social distancing is key to stemming this pandemic.
